it.polimi.se2018.model.dice

Class Die

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.model.dice.Die

  • public class Die
extends java.lang.Object
    Model representation of a die with six faces(d6)
    Author:
    Al√¨ El Wahsh

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Die(ColorModel color)
      The die will have a color and a temporary value when built, in case it's rendered before the first roll

      This method simulates the roll of the dice assigning a value between 1 and 6 to it.
      boolean setFace(int newValue)
      Some rules give the player the ability to change a die's upper face, so I added this method to let external entities change the value within the admitted range

    • Constructor Detail

      • Die

        public Die(ColorModel color)
        The die will have a color and a temporary value when built, in case it's rendered before the first roll
        Parameters:
        color - it's the dice color assigned during game initialization

    • Method Detail

      • roll

        public void roll()
        This method simulates the roll of the dice assigning a value between 1 and 6 to it. During a roll no thread can see the die, avoiding possible inconsistencies. For now I'll use a simple random generation. May use a different and less polarized algorithm in the future.

      • getColor

        public ColorModel getColor()
        Getter for the color variable
        Returns:
        die's color

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Getter for the value variable
        Returns:
        die's upper face

      • setFace

        public boolean setFace(int newValue)
        Some rules give the player the ability to change a die's upper face, so I added this method to let external entities change the value within the admitted range
        Parameters:
        newValue - new die's upper face
        Returns:
        true if the new value is valid, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Simple toString method for CLI and log
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string formed by the color and the value of the die
        See Also:
        toString() method
